question: The cells of endosperm tissue are filled with ______.
The most common type of endosperm development is ______.
In free-nuclear endosperm, the PEN undergoes successive ______ divisions.
The stage of endosperm development with free nuclei is called ______ endosperm.
After free-nuclear stage, ______ formation occurs and endosperm becomes cellular.
The coconut water of tender coconut is nothing but ______ endosperm.
The surrounding white kernel of coconut is the ______ endosperm.
Endosperm may be completely consumed by the developing ______ before seed maturation.
In pea, groundnut and beans, the endosperm is ______ before seed maturation.
In castor and coconut, endosperm persists in the ______ seed.
Persistent endosperm in cereals can be found in wheat, ______ and maize.
Embryo develops at the ______ end of the embryo sac.
Most zygotes divide only after formation of certain amount of ______.
Early stages of embryo development are called ______.
The zygote gives rise to the proembryo and then to the ______ shaped embryo.
A typical dicotyledonous embryo consists of embryonal axis and ______ cotyledons.
The portion of embryonal axis above cotyledons is called ______.
The epicotyl terminates with the ______ or stem tip.
The cylindrical portion below cotyledons is called ______.
The hypocotyl terminates at its lower end in the ______.
The root tip is covered with a ______.
Embryos of monocotyledons possess only ______ cotyledon.
In grasses, the cotyledon is called ______.
The scutellum is situated towards one side of the ______ axis.
